items.title: 2 Children Are Dead and 2 Are in Critical Condition in Texas Shooting
items.summary: A 13-year-old and 4-year-old were killed, officials said. A 9-year-old and 8-year-old were airlifted for medical care and were in critical condition.

items.title: Who Still Has Temporary Protected Status?
items.summary: Conflicting court rulings have plunged hundreds of thousands of people with temporary protection from deportation into uncertainty.

items.title: Trump’s Approach on Gaza: Deal First, Details Later
items.summary: “We’ll see how it all turns out,” President Trump said after Hamas agreed to portions of his cease-fire plan, with conditions.

items.title: Trump Seizes On Government Shutdown to Punish Political Foes
items.summary: The White House has cut or paused billions in funding to Democratic-run cities and states since the federal government came to a halt.

items.title: Partisan Messaging During Government Shutdown Could Hurt Civil Service, Experts Warn
items.summary: Messages on official government channels blaming Democrats for the shutdown are one of the most significant hits yet to the longstanding wall between federal workers and politics, historians said.

items.title: The Tech Jester Who Pranks San Francisco
items.summary: Riley Walz, 23, has gained fame for his online antics. His latest stunt has upset city officials.

items.title: US treasury considers special $1 Trump coin reading ‘fight, fight, fight’
items.summary: <p>US treasurer says officials looking at drafts for country’s 250th anniversary featuring president with raised fist</p><p>To commemorate the 250th anniversary of the US’s independence, the treasury department is mulling production of a $1 coin displaying <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> with a clenched first under an American flag and the words “fight, fight, fight”.</p><p>The words overtly reference what Trump said immediately after narrowly surviving an assassination attempt four months before he won a second presidency.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/03/trump-coin-treasury">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: How Democrats are trying to bust Republican lies about healthcare for undocumented immigrants
items.summary: <p>At the centre of the government shutdown is the issue of healthcare for Americans being stripped by Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’</p><p>Leading up to the government shutdown on Wednesday, congressional Republicans and Donald Trump have repeated misleading claims that Democrats were trying to pass a resolution that would provide “free healthcare for illegals”. It’s become a well-rehearsed refrain fueling GOP lawmakers as government funding lapsed this week.</p><p>At the White House on Wednesday, the vice-president JD Vance said the Democrats’ spending plan “would have undone” the work of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA) – which <a href="https://www.nilc.org/resources/new-law-limits-health-care-food-aid-for-immigrants/">ended the eligibility</a> of many types of lawfully present immigrants to access federally funded health coverage, like Medicaid, Medicare and Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies for private health insurance.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/04/government-shutdown-republican-lies-healthcare-immigrants">Continue reading...</a>
